summary: This code sets up a Docker container with specific resource limitations and runs the Alpine image with a shell session. The --read-only flag ensures the container's filesystem is read-only, which can improve performance if using XFS file system.

details.comment: This code sets up a Docker container with specific resource limitations and runs the Alpine image with a shell session. The --read-only flag ensures the container's filesystem is read-only, which can improve performance if using XFS file system.
details.content:
#!/bin/bash
docker run --read-only --rm --kernel-memory="8m" --memory-swap="16m" --cpus="0.05" --memory="16m" --memory-reservation="8m" -it alpine sh
# --read-only
# if it is XFS it is way better than now.
